SENT.plain: Benign intracranial hypertension (idiopathic hypertension, pseudomotor cerebrii) describes the syndrome of elevated intracranial pressure without clinical, laboratory or radiological evidence of a focal lesion
Unlike conditions where intracranial pressure is raised due to a space-occupying lesion, dural puncture is not contraindicated
In this report we describe the delivery by caesarean section of a parturient with this rare condition using the needle through needle combined spinal-epidural technique
